Fundraising Business Cards

Options
  • Mark as New
  • Bookmark
  • Subscribe to Direct Replies to This Post
  • Subscribe to RSS Feed
  • Highlight
  • Print
  • Email to a Friend
  • Report Inappropriate Content

â09-16-2012 06:44 AM

One of my most successful strategies in 2012 was to print buisiness cards on my home computer. On the front of the card was information about the Tour de Cure and the American Diabetes Association. On the back was a personal statement from me and my contact information including how to donate by check or online. I handed these out to anyone I talked to and received many donations, sometimes weeks later, from people who had the card laying on their desk, stuck in their wallet, or pinned to their bulletin board. I found this just as effective as emails and Facebook.

Report Inappropriate Content

â09-21-2012 03:39 PM

I did something similar, but I put a QR Code on the back so people could easily scan with a smart phone.  A good QR Code generator can be found at http://qrcode.kaywa.com/.

 

Also a good idea to use one of the short url services to create a URL that's short enough to be entered by hand.

"The universe doesn't care what you believe. The wonderful thing about science is that it doesn't ask for your faith, it just asks for your eyes"
--- http://xkcd.com/c154.html
